Key Arguments: The legislation is an attack on democracy, freedom of speech, and freedom of expression.
It attempts to silence dissenting viewpoints and excludes government and mainstream media from its scope.
Politicians and mainstream media are major sources of misinformation and disinformation.
Independent journalists who reveal truths could be silenced by this legislation.
What is considered misinformation now could be proven true in the future.
The legislation gives too much power to potentially corrupt individuals.
Australia is a democratic country and should not have such restrictive laws.
Existing laws, such as defamation laws, are sufficient.
Freedom of speech is already being stifled by media platforms.
Penalties for expressing beliefs are unjust.
The legislation is costly and funds could be better spent on public services.
Notable Quotes: This Proposed Legislation, it is an attack on Democracy, Freedom of Speech, and Freedom of Expression.
Politicians are the biggest culprits of Misinformation and Disinformation.
This Legislation gives power to a few people who may be Corrupt, could be Bribed, Influenced or have their own agenda.
Australia is supposed to be a democratic and free Country, if you don't like it, Leave and go live in a country that has no freedom.
This Legislation is very Dangerous and must be STOPPED.
